name: Tivoli Victoria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow!! this hotel was definately 5*! My partner and I stayed here for one week at the start of June, absolutely loved this hotel! The room itself was lovely- maid service twice a day. Breakfast was also excellent- huge variety/selection including salmon and champange if you wished! The hotel facilities we could not fault- with use of the spa facilities for free. The pool side had waiter service from the bar, the most comfy sun loungers- which were free and we never had any difficulty getting a lounger. The shuttle bus is another excellent free service to and from the marina- just be there early to ensure u get on the bus as it is a small bus however the driver does come back for this who could not get on the first time! We took a day trip to Loule through a company based at the marina side- the coach picked us up from the hotel and we then had the morning to explore this lovely little village and both the gypsy and local food markets - well worth 12 euros for us both!!
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.text: The marina has so many lovely bars/resturants- we were only sorry we never had enough time to go to them all!
reviews.title: Classy & Relaxed

reviews.text: We visited the Marina tivoli for drinks- this is also a lovely hotel- however we preferred the victoria as it was newer- with better sunloungers!!
reviews.title: Lives up to 5*

reviews.text: We would go back to Tivoli Victoria and have recommended it to our family/friends!!

reviews.text: I stayed at The Tivoli Victoria for 3 nights recently while in the area for business.
reviews.title: Fabulous 10 Days
very dissapointing
reviews.text: This is modern hotel with a lovely pool area with very comfortable sun beds. The rooms themselves are clean and attractive and up to expectations, although I agree about the comments on the Pillows, they smell awful. Beware coming here in August as there is an outdoor night club that goes on till 4 and sometimes 6 in the morning and the base permeates your room. Make sure you get a room as far away as possible. Food by the pool is very mediocre as was the buffet I don't know what room service is like as we ordered breakfast for 06.30 - 07.00 and it did not arrive. Little things let this hotel down badly, for example we ordered a litre bottle of water by the pool and asked if we could have an ice bucket to keep it cool. I laughed when I was informed they only had 2 ice buckets and needed them for wine ( I don't know what they do if they sell more than 2 bottles! Bottom line is that with a bit of attention to detail it would be very easy to bring this Hotel up to 5 star standard and I can only assume the fault lies with the management.

reviews.title: The hotel was lovely.
reviews.text: The hotel was lovely. However, on arrival the room was not ready which was fine (we were early) but the hotel kept us waiting until the 2pm check in time (checking their watches the whole time). When we were eventually sent to a room it was not ready!! The room was lovely..although the pillows had a strange wiff. The hotel is a little in the middle of no where but the hotels shuttle bus service was (on the whole) reliable and took you to the Marina within 10 minutes. The hotel pool was wonderful. The loungers were topped with a wonderful mattress like material which meant you could lie there all day. You could also make use of the loungers in the evening whilst having a drink in the hotel bar.

reviews.title: Oh dear what a shame!
reviews.text: A beautiful hotel set in a golf area. 5star it is not some work needs to be done to make it a standard acceptable to 5 star expectations.

We have just come back from a less than satisfactory stay at the Tivoli Victoria Hotel. We stayed for 8 nights to celebrate our graduation but sadly there wasn't much to celebrate at this allegedly 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: Don't go!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arriving at 9.45 pm we were told that there was nowhere that we could eat dinner as the Sensorial restaurant closes at 9.30 and Emo restaurant was closed for a private conference. This meant that the only two options was the snack menu in the bar or room service. We opted for room service as we wanted more of a meal than a snack. This meal was, oddly, probably the best meal we ate during our entire stay at the hotel.
reviews.title: A wonderful stay at the Tivoli Victoria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast the next morning did not meet our expectations of a five star hotel... The full English option was frankly disgusting and served in a school dinner style. The pancakes are not made freshly and look as though they are bought in and re-heated, hence their rubber-like quality. The bread was stale as it was clearly from the day before, as were the hams and cheeses. The fruit was clearly from a tin and not appetising in the slightest.
reviews.title: great value -perfect service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hoping to explore the surrounding area a little, we asked at reception for a dinner recommendation, to which the man behind the desk told us he could only think of one restaurant... Fabulous! Things carried on in this fashion throughout our whole stay and we found nice restaurants ourselves and after the recommendations of our taxi driver,who we had to find ourselves as reception said that they wouldn't be able to get hold of one for us for 40 minutes... 20 minutes later we were on our way to dinner in a taxi we had found and called for ourselves. When asking the hotel to make dinner reservations for us, they asked us to provide the number of the restaurant that we were going to- not much of a concierge service that one would expect to find in a five star hotel!
reviews.title: Great relaxed holiday!!
Excellent holiday
reviews.text: Disappointingly, Pop bar was also closed during our entire stay so we could not go in there for a drink. We were very dismayed to find that halfway through our stay the hotel was invaded by over 100 people from a conference... This was fine, except it had many repercussions for the guests already staying at the hotel. Sadly, the sun loungers were cleared from half of the pool and moved onto the grass to make room for their dinner celebrations, in which they used glass glasses which smashed and left broken glass around the children's pool the next day. Furthermore, Sensorial restaurant was closed at lunch time for the conference and we were kept awake until 5 am from screaming and running down the corridors. Again, it let like we were on a school trip and it was clear that we were not the hotel's priority. When complaining to the duty manager, we were offered a complimentary meal at the buffet, even though we had told them we had already made dinner reservations for the rest of our stay.

reviews.title: Lovely Hotel but a few details need attention
reviews.text: Tivoli Victoria is mostly a beautiful hotel and we had a lovely stay. Our room was beautiful but just a few small things missing for a 5 star hotel I thought:

reviews.title: Great Holiday
reviews.text: 1. Pools (we were mostly at the quieter smaller pool) did not appear to be cleaned out on a daily basis as I would have expected.

reviews.title: lovely few days
reviews.text: 2. On arrival our rooms were not ready and we were directed to a toilet/changing area on the lower level which smelt musty and appeared to be having maintenance work done...not a good initial impression of hotel.

reviews.title: Chill out hotel
reviews.text: 3. This same area which are the toilets closest to the small pool area were closed completely on our last days there for painting....surely this could have been done at a quieter time...afterall this was 2nd week of July and surely peak holiday season. Maintenance work too evident to guests for 5 star hotel I thought.

reviews.title: Mixed feelings about this hotel
reviews.text: 4. The golf course was closed for complete duration of our stay ...something which was not pointed out to us either by Expedia at time of booking or subsequently by the hotel when I was contacting them on advance of our arrival...we had hoped to golf a couple of days but luckily it was not main reason for our stay.

reviews.title: Great for golf, boring at night,nothing for kids
reviews.text: The decor is stylish as expected in a fairly new hotel. Staff very helpful and service excellent. Room was very nice though hard to find and involved a lengthly walk. Buffet breakfast was excellent but coffee was poor. On the downside the golf course and clubhouse were closed during our entire 10 day trip and we were not told this when we booked. The Popbar only opened once the whole time we were there because apparently it only opens if the hotel is busy!!!!!! We were there with our 11 year old son and there was absolutely nothing to do at night. We had to go to the marina every night and use the sister hotel for entertainment.

reviews.title: Exceptional
reviews.text: Well as the title suggests My husband & I enjoyed a very last minute long weekend break here from 15th-18th July.

reviews.title: Nicely-decorated modern residences
reviews.text: Positives: -

reviews.title: Well equipped apartments
reviews.text: Very efficient reception, we booked in at 9.30 am & was told the check in is not until 3pm but until then we were more than welcome to use all the hotels facilities. They then proceeded to have our room ready by 12 noon.

reviews.title: Infinitely better than expected - superbly relaxing!
reviews.text: The room was wonderful, the bed and pillows are to die for, the most comfortable I have ever slept in(including my own at home!!). It was quite spacious we both liked the open planned bathroom with walk in shower too.

reviews.title: Better than ever!
reviews.text: We've just returned from our second stay at the Tivoli Victoria Hotel. We had a brilliant 6 day stay. We arrived at 10.30am and were given our rooms several hours early. were just in time for breakfast. Breakfast here is just fantastic. Every type of fresh fruit, cereals, pastries, cold meats, yogurts, juices and of course a huge selection of cooked items to choose from.

reviews.title: Residences
reviews.text: I don't understand the review which stated that there was only tinned fruit. I didn't see any.

reviews.title: Stunning Hotel
reviews.text: Dinner is available as a buffet ( different theme every night) which costs €35 and includes water, soft drinks and beer / wine. The waiters are very generous at topping up the glasses!! Children under 12 are free.

reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, lovely staff and wonderful loungers!
reviews.text: The main pool area is just great and has free WIFI. It's also very well staffed with pool boys to move sunshades or find you a sunbed if it's busy though there are plenty to go around. In fact were always able to find plenty even at 11.30am.

reviews.title: Lovely place, 10 mins outside Vilamoura,
reviews.text: Criticisms would be that pool snacks are very overpriced €14 for a club sandwich and €8 for a very basic soggy cheese toastie. This found is not of the same standard as breakfast or dinner.

description: Tivoli Victoria is a luxury 5 star hotel. All rooms have panoramic views over the fairways of the golf course. With 18 greens, the Victoria Golf course designed by Arnold Palmer is known as one of the best courses in Europe. Tivoli Victoria is also perfect for conferences, events wich require the highest quality facilities Experience leisure in one of the hotel swimming pools, and revive your spirit at the Elements Spa by Banyan Tree.
